title: Long-Time behavior of the tangential surface Navier-Stokes equation
abstract:
We investigate the initial-value problem for the incompressible tangential
Navier-Stokes equation with variable viscosity on a given two-dimensional
surface without boundary. Existence of global weak and strong solutions under
inhomogeneous forcing is proved by a fixed-point and continuation argument.
Continuous dependence on data, backward uniqueness, and instantaneous
regularization are also discussed. Depending on the effect of the inhomogeneous
forcing on the dissipative and the nondissipative components of the system, we
investigate the long-time behavior of solutions. We prove the existence and
properties of the $\sigma$-global attractor, in the case of bounded
trajectories, and of the so-called unbounded attractor, for unbounded
trajectories.
